result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Emanuel Allen

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Aaron Emanuel Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Aaron Emanuel Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial. Defendant has a pending case, 22CF3054, that is set for a scheduling conference today.  State is requesting to join the two cases and because that case is set for a status today is not ready to proceed today and requesting an adjournment.  Defense is requesting time to respond in writing.  Court granted State's motion for adjournment. Defendant enters speedy trial demand.  Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 2:00 pm for final pretrial/ motion for joinder and 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Defense has until 11-18-22 to respond to motion for joinder.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Aaron Emanuel Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference along with defendant's other pending case.  Case is adjourned to 10-24-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Aaron Emanuel Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 2:30 pm for a status conference along with defendant's other pending case.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

*** Case heard in front of Judge Swanson, Branch 11, for Judge Havas, Branch 10 ***

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Aaron Emanuel Allen.  Attorney Michelle Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court scheduled a status conference to tag along with other pending matter in front of Judge Havas (22CF926).  Case adjourned to Branch 10, Rm 504 CH.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Case will be heard in Br. 11 for Br. 10.

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Aaron Emanuel Allen. Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #22CF926. Sworn for the State: DA Investigator M. Wilkerson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 10.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney McGinn is unavailable for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for  CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MLY (DOB: 07/19/1980).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Aaron Emanuel Allen in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron Emanuel Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Case is adjourned to Br. PE for BR 10.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
